001package ca.gc.cra.radar.api;
002
003import java.io.FileDescriptor;
004import java.io.FileOutputStream;
005import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
006import java.io.PrintWriter;
007import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
008
009/**
010 * Minimal console output helper for CLI usage text.
011 *
012 * <p>Uses native file descriptors in order to avoid direct {@code System.out} references while
013 * preserving simple stdout writes that play nicely with logging configurations.</p>
014 */
015public final class CliPrinter {
016  private static final PrintWriter STDOUT = new PrintWriter(
017      new OutputStreamWriter(new FileOutputStream(FileDescriptor.out), StandardCharsets.UTF_8), true);
018  private static volatile PrintWriter override;
019
020  private CliPrinter() {
021    // Utility
022  }
023
024  /**
025   * Prints a single line to stdout using the shared CLI writer.
026   *
027   * @param message line to emit
028   */
029  public static void println(String message) {
030    writer().println(message);
031  }
032
033  /**
034   * Prints zero or more lines to stdout using the shared CLI writer.
035   *
036   * @param lines lines to emit
037   */
038  public static void printLines(String... lines) {
039    if (lines == null) {
040      return;
041    }
042    PrintWriter writer = writer();
043    for (String line : lines) {
044      writer.println(line);
045    }
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Overrides the CLI writer for tests.
050   *
051   * @param writer writer to use during the test
052   */
053  static void setWriterForTesting(PrintWriter writer) {
054    override = writer;
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Clears any test writer override.
059   */
060  static void clearTestWriter() {
061    override = null;
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Resolves the active writer, preferring a test override.
066   *
067   * @return writer used for CLI output
068   */
069  private static PrintWriter writer() {
070    return override != null ? override : STDOUT;
071  }
072}
